title.narrative: OUTPUT 19: CP LAWS AND REGULATIONS

description.narrative: By 2022, child and family welfare, justice for children and birth registration laws and regulations are aligned with child protection policies and international standards., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, child and family welfare, justice for children and birth registration laws and regulations are aligned with childprotection policies and international standards.

description.narrative: Priorities from the Child and Family Welfare Policy and Justice for Children Policy, including the Integrated Social Services Initiative, have been added to the National Medium-Term Development Policy Framework 2022-2025. An evaluation of the previous iteration of the medium-term plans indicated a strong representation of child protection priorities in the 2018-2021 period. Two evaluations of the child protection programme have been completed indicating a solid contribution of the child protection programme to strengthening the national child protection and social welfare system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
